instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: No trackpad or keyboard on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.
threads.message: I'm struggling to figure out what the final piece of this puzzle is. I've restored endless voltages to this very wrecked board and it boots with everything functioning normally now expect the trackpad and keyboard are unresponsive. No caps lock light. I'm comparing the circuits to a known-good board pulled from a computer with a cracked screen and I can't find any difference in voltage or diode measurements. Any thoughts on good places to look next?

threads.title: No trackpad or keyboard on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.
No trackpad or keyboard on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.
threads.message: Thanks, sorry, forgot to mention that I've done all the basics. I've installed the known-good board and the keyboard/trackpad work normally.

threads.title: No trackpad or keyboard on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.
threads.message: press power button and hold alt key, does it go to boot selection screen???

threads.title: No trackpad or keyboard on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.
No trackpad or keyboard on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.
threads.message: Voltage on pin 1 and 27 from J4802??? <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>??

threads.title: No trackpad or keyboard on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.
threads.message: All are good. 3.3V on 27 and 12.6 on 1. <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is at 3.3V. I checked it at all points. No breaks in the line - it's getting to the trackpad circuit.

threads.title: No trackpad or keyboard on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.
threads.message: Check power to <CHIP>U4820</CHIP>/30. Does the trackpad start to click once powered on?

threads.title: No trackpad or keyboard on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.
threads.message: Yes, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4_TPAD</SIGNAL> is there. The voltages around <CHIP>U4820</CHIP> and <CHIP>U4830</CHIP> are all the same as the good board. The forcetouch click does turn on when the computer comes on but the trackpad button doesn't do anything when clicked. The trackpad is not recognized under System Preferences. Power button is all that works.

threads.title: No trackpad or keyboard on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.
threads.message: Connect external keyboard and go into boot menu and see if KB/TP does anything.

threads.title: No trackpad or keyboard on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.
threads.message: No, nothing at the menu. Only the external works. No internal trackpad, keyboard. Also, no caps lock light.

threads.title: No trackpad or keyboard on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.
threads.message: Inspect connector on the board for corrosion/damage. Must be corrosion around there somewhere.

threads.title: No trackpad or keyboard on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.
threads.message: Ok, I'll check that again. Could this possibly be a bad <CHIP>U4830</CHIP>? Or one of the other chips along the bottom that were hit pretty hard by corrosion? The voltages around them are good but I'm not sure what that means as far as them doing their job.

threads.title: No trackpad or keyboard on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.
threads.message: I doubt that <CHIP>U4830</CHIP> could mess it up. It could mess things up if the SDA/SCL lines are shorted maybe. The trackpad will probably work without them, but never checked so not 100% sure.
